entry.title: S/4 HANA 2025 - ABAP Cloud Outbound http Client
entry.content:
How can we set up on-premise SAP S/4 HANA 2025 Outbound HTTP services, using only released APIs?

Package S_UNIFIED_CON_HTTP_CLIENT is full of released APIs, including CL_WEB_CLIENT_PROVIDER which looks promising. This class is based on Communication Targets. From various docs and tutorials, communication targets require 1) communication scenario and 2) outbound service to function.

From Eclipse ADT - Neither of these ABAP repository objects are available on our S/4 HANA 2025 system. Hoping to get clarification on the ABAP Cloud compatible (released APIs only) of using HTTP Clients. 

SAP Communication Targets Tutorial:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n6_rekYKcwY

__PRESENT

__PRESENT

__PRESENT

__PRESENT

__PRESENT

entry.title: STR not created between MRP Areas (area type 01 and 02) in S4 Hana
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a scenario with 2 MRP areas, one is a storage location MRP area (Area type 02) and the other one is the plant MRP Area Type 01.

At the plant level Im assigning special procurement key Z1 with special type F and U and stock stransfer 1 (Purchase requisitions from plant to MRP area)

I have maitained the Sloc for EP so that the requisition gets correct Sloc and it is also getting correct issuing storage location.

Problem is that MRP is creating an PRreq not an STR, I mean item category is blank, not U.

Bottom line issue is that in MD04 under the Sloc MRP area I cannot see the requirement (PRqRel) in the Individual list and if I switch to Intra Plant View there I can see the PurRqs

Is this because STRs will work under MRP areas of the same type only or am I doing something wrong?

Notes:

Even if I add the item category U after MRP creates the PReq it will not work, requirement will not be n Sloc MRP Area

 If I take the PReq created from mrp (even without manually adding the item category) and convert that to PO then it will be STO, meaning item category "U" will be there and requirement will be shown correctly in Sloc MRP area, and the strange part is that if I delete the STO then the Preq will be opened again but now the requirement is shown correctly in Sloc MRP Area. At this point item category is blank again but field is now grayed out even in change mode.

- FINS_GRIR_STATUS_WRITE_OFF for the write off

When I execute I can’t find no data.

could you give a help on how to proceed ? Thanks.

entry.title: Differences between DDL and DML in HANA
entry.content:
DDL: It refers to Data definition language which is to define or change the structure of a object. Below are the few examples of DDL actions

CREATE - This privilege is to create database objects like tables, schemas 

ALTER - This privilege is to alter/modify the structure of a object like table

DROP - This privilege is to delete the database object like DROP TABLE statement 

DML: It refers to Data Manipulation language which is to manipulate (create/modify/delete) the data inside the object. Below are the few examples for DML actions.

INSERT - When a user is given access to INSERT privilege on top a table, then user can insert new record into the table

DELETE- When a user is given access to DELETE privilege on top a table, then user can delete a record from the table

UPDATE- When a user is given access to UPDATE privilege on top a table, then user can update an existign record of a table

#SAPHANA #DDL #DML

entry.title: How to view balance confirmation history for customer/vendor in S/4HANA?
entry.content:
Dear everyone,

as part of a S/4HANA transformation (S/4HANA on premise - 02 (10/2024) fps), I am looking to find a way to view stored document history of created balance confirmations in the past per customer/vendor, as it can be viewed in R3 via attachment list function (Transaction VD03 /VK03). I am generating balance confirmations (programm SAPF130D_PDF/SAPF130K_PDF) using transaction F17P/F18P. However, once the confirmations are generated and visible in spool, the PDFs are not centrally stored somewhere and cannot be accessed afterwards. What options do I have for that case or what need to be done in advance? 

Thank you in advance for any advice on this matter

Kind regards

entry.title: How do you practically map business requirements to SAP standard (scope items / best practices)?
entry.content:
I’m working on a project that supports SAP consultants in going from business requirements / BRDs to:
• SAP Best Practice scope items / standard processes
• Fit / Fit with configuration / Gap decisions
• Configuration & enhancement work packages
• Building a Signavio process flow
 
I’d love to understand how experienced consultants actually do this mapping in real projects – not the textbook version, but what happens in workshops, Excel trackers, Signavio, etc.
 
Could you share your approach on the points below?

entry.title: Datasphere SQL: expected_unsigned_integer error on tinyint
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm trying to write a simple SQL script that echoes the value passed through an input parameter. I would like to use this in a derive-value variable so the format and length must match. Therefore I would also like to cast the value to a field of certain length (another Input Parameter). 

The following SQL code doesn't validate and the error I get is: "expected_unsigned_integer". IP_LEN is type HANA.tinyint which is unsigned, so I'm not sure what the problem is here. Any ideas?

SELECT CAST(:IP_VAL as VARCHAR(:IP_LEN)) VALUE
FROM DUMMY_TABLE;

Regards,

Dimitar

entry.title: How to Connect Google Looker Studio with SAP HANA 2022 On-Premise?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I’m trying to connect Google Looker Studio with an SAP HANA 2022 on-premise system.

So far, I haven’t found a straightforward connector in Looker Studio that supports direct HANA connections.

If anyone has successfully set this up, could you please share the steps, configuration details, or any required middleware/connectors?

Key questions:

  • What is the recommended method to expose SAP HANA on-premise data to Looker Studio (e.g., JDBC/ODBC, APIs, Data Federation, Cloud Connector, etc.)?
  • Are there any specific network or authentication settings needed?
  • Is there an official or 3rd-party connector that works reliably?

Any guidance, documentation links, or step-by-step procedure would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Pull MDEZ & WBS Data
entry.content:
Hello, 

 

I am trying to find a way to recreate the below table using data out of SAP. Most of the data is in MDEZ, but MDEZ isn't a real table that data can be pulled from. Can you assist me in recreating that table / other tables to pull data into Excel (or a report). 

 

Supplier Name Model Name   
Line Unit 0001000200030004
Load Date 12/312/1512/2012/25
      

Part Number:
1000000

Qty in-stock

Due on Dock DateIf SAP shows that the part number to the left has been issued to the line unit above, mark "C". If there is stock to cover the line unit, mark as "S".If there is no stock and it has not been issued, put the Date Column on Stock/Requirements List (MDEZ) 

 

Some of the items that I have found are below:

Field Description

Table Name

Field Name

Part Number

MARA

MATNR

Description

MAKT

MAKTX

Supplier Code

EINA

MATNR

Supplier Name

LFA1

LIFNR

QOH

EBAN

MNG02

Minor Model

Need to speak to SAP to determine why I cannot see this.

MAJOR_MODEL

Required Date on Floor (UCL)

This is the Date Column on Stock/Requirements List. F1 says MDEZ-DAT00 but I don't have MDEZ in SAP Hana.

 

Line Units

 

This comes from a WBS Element that I cannot determine where it compiles the data from.  On the Production Order Display: Header screen, under assignment and then section "assignments", there is a WBS Element. The number I need is digits 9-12 of that element and then that number should trace back to a sales order line item number. F1 says the table and field are: AFPOD-PROJN but when I go to that table, the string of data doesn't exist.

On phase 20 confirmation done for 50 pc.
Now While confirming the Phase 40 system proposing 100 PC.
If this is not available in standard is there any reason for proposing the whole order quantity irrespective of previous yield

entry.title: HANA Replication
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We are planning to upgrade the memory of our existing PERSON_NAME appliance and aim to minimize downtime throughout the process.

Currently, the HANA Database System Replication is configured from the Primary Node to the Secondary Node using Log Replay, and from the Secondary Node to the Tertiary Node. The upgrade strategy involves failing over from the Primary to the Secondary Node and upgrading the Primary Node first. During the upgrade, replication will continue with the Tertiary Node. After the upgrade is completed, we will initiate replication from the Secondary Node back to the Primary Node, establishing multi-node replication. Once replication is active, we will fail back to the Primary Node and reconfigure replication from the Primary to the Secondary and from the Primary to the Tertiary Node for multi-node replication. After replication is established, we will perform the Secondary Node memory upgrade, aiming to ensure continuous business operations with the Tertiary Node as a safeguard. Due to limited bandwidth, we do not want to maintain a full replica between the Primary Node and the Tertiary Node.

Please help us understand how to avoid a full replica rebuild when replication switches from the primary node to the tertiary node. Additionally, let us know how we can ensure that, during replication initialization, it will start with either a full replica or a delta update.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: indexserverについて推奨パラメータでないことが性能に与える影響はあるか？
entry.content:
SP1の以下のパラメータについて、現在の設定値が推奨値とは異なる値に設定されています。
・max_num_recompile_threads
→現在値：<PERSON_NAME kernel>、推奨値：<between 6 and 32>
・suspended_cursor_lifetime
 →現在値：720、推奨値：<between DIGITS and ZIPCODE>

つきましては以下をご教示いただけますでしょうか。
①この設定がindexserverのパフォーマンスにどの程度影響を与えているか
②パラメータの値を変更することでどのような効果があるか
③変更する必要がある場合、それぞれどの値を設定すればよいか


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Billing date determination on a manually entered billing plan line
entry.content:
Hi All,

After updating the Date Determination Rule in the billing plan, the new logic is not being applied to manually added billing plan lines. The requirement is for the billing date to always be 11 days after the “Settlement From” date. In the example shown in the screenshot, the billing date should be 12.12.2025, but the system still defaults it to 1.12.2025, which is the same as the “Settlement From” date.

I have attached:
1) Billing plan line 

2) Date rule determination config

Is there a way to achieve this using configuration?

 

Thanks.

entry.title: Billing date determination for manually entered billing plan line
entry.content:
After updating the Date Determination Rule in the billing plan, the new logic is not being applied to manually added billing plan lines. The requirement is for the billing date to always be 11 days after the “Settlement From” date. In the example shown in the screenshot, the billing date should be 12.12.2025, but the system still defaults it to 1.12.2025, which is the same as the “Settlement From” date.

Please refer to the screenshots.
